channel.title: Which one?
channel.description: Simple enough, which program should I use for coding Java and C++? I'm used to how notepad++ works, but I would like to give Dreamweaver a try. All in all, which one would be better for these two languages?

item.title: Which one?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I use JCreator pro and it’s amazing. I don’t ever see anyone else using it though. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Which one?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:15, topic:347705”][quote author=Lin link=topic=444090.msg3260783#msg3260783 date=1278469029]
…Dream Weaver is a website editor and just so happens to support other programming languages. Notepad++ is very poor and should be used when no IDE is available. In answer to your question, neither; use an IDE.
[/quote]

I love Notepad++ :D. It has much more sexy syntax highlighting then netbeans and eclipse. jus sayin[/quote]
Are you serious, this topic was over 2 weeks old.

Read full topic

@lesterknome wrote:

Lin:

…Dream Weaver is a website editor and just so happens to support other programming languages. Notepad++ is very poor and should be used when no IDE is available. In answer to your question, neither; use an IDE.

I love Notepad++ :D. It has much more sexy syntax highlighting then netbeans and eclipse. jus sayin

item.title: Which one?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:7, topic:347705”]eclipse, netbeans, intellij idea

visual studio, sharpdevelop[/quote]'nuff said; let it die now…

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:347705”][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=444090.msg3264736#msg3264736 date=1278784415]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=444090.msg3261034#msg3261034 date=1278489151]

Netbeans if you must an IDE, but I just use notepad
[/quote]I use notepad as well

Yeah and you write horribad code so shut the fuck up and stop giving input where it isn’t wanted.

@rip4d: use the community edition of IntelliJ IDEA. http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/
[/quote]Fuck off? This isn’t a thread about my coding abilities, and actually I didn’t read anywhere in the main post where it said only certain people could give input.[/quote]Your correct.

Read full topic
